_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Description

Alto Columbia, LLC operates as a fuel ethanol production plant located in Boardman, Morrow County, Oregon. As a requirement of the Clean Air Act Amendments 112(r) Accidental Release of Hazardous Air Substances program, Alto Columbia, LLC has completed a 5-Year Update to its risk management plan (RMP) for chemicals stored on-site that are above reporting thresholds. 



Regulated Substances Handled

The facility produces fuel grade ethanol from corn and a process co-product known as wet distillers' grain, Syrup and corn oil which are used as a livestock feed. Aqueous ammonia is stored on-site and used in the ethanol production process for pH control when blending the corn flour with water. The maximum aqueous ammonia stored will be approximately 25,000 gallons or 195,000 pounds. The ammonia tank is located in a concrete containment dike. Natural Gasoline used as Denaturant can contain pentane and butane in varying percentages depending on the location of the gasoline well it was harvested from. Alto Columbia has prepared this RMP based on a "worst-case" scenario (i.e., assumes the natural gasoline as 100% flammable mixture of RMP chemicals). The maximum amount of denaturant on-site is estimated to be approximately 78,000 gallons or 440,000 pounds. The natural gasoline is stored in an above ground tank as a liquid and is blended into the fuel ethanol in the final stage of production. The denaturant tank is located in the facility's tank farm area which includes a secondary containment dike. Alto Columbia, LLC has evaluated the worst-case and alternative case scenarios as it relates to the reportable substances. An emergency response program for these scenarios has been prepared and implemented. Alto Columbia, LLC has coordinated emergency response with the local authorities and conducts periodic drills.



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

Alto Columbia, LLC is committed to the protection of its employees, the greater

community and the environment from hazardous substances used in the ethanol fuel production process, specifically aqueous ammonia and pentane/butane, as a constituent of the natural gasoline used as the ethanol denaturant. The ammonia is used for pH control directly in the process feed mixture to fermentation. The denaturant is added to the ethanol to make the ethanol unfit for human consumption. It is the policy of Alto Columbia, LLC to comply with all applicable federal, state, and local laws. In the event of an emergency, including an accidental release of toxics and flammables, it is the policy of Alto Columbia, LLC to notify the Boardman Rural Fire Protection District, Morrow County Sheriff Department, and Morrow County Emergency Management.



General Accidental Release Prevention Program

Through the completion of this RMP, Alto Columbia, LLC has complied with the EPA requirements under 40 CFR Part 68. Process safety information and operations/maintenance procedures are documented on-site. Periodic functions such as process hazard analysis, training, change management and incident investigation are conducted on a regular basis. Audits of the overall RMP will be conducted on a regular basis to assure compliance with EPA regulations.



Five-Year Accident History 

Alto Columbia, LLC has not had an accidents which may have caused death, injuries, environmental or property damage, evacuations or in-place sheltering in the last five years. This facility started operating in August 2007.



Emergency Response Program 

Alto Columbia LLC has developed response efforts to a variety of potential scenarios involving hazardous substances stored and used at the facility. These efforts have been coordinated with state and federal regulating agencies and local responders as well as spill contractors.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety 

Alto Columbia, LLC is committed to the protection of its employees, the greater community and the environment from hazardous substance

s used in the ethanol fuel production process. Management is committed to promoting a safe work environment. Alto Columbia, LLC will continue to provide its employees with the necessary training, tools, and ongoing support needed to conduct their work safely and to operate the ethanol production process in a safe and efficient manner.
